reviews.review: Love this game. Absolutely love it. Everyone should play it. I started out not liking it as much, but now I'm in love with this game. One of my favorite games now. Give it a try. You won't be disappointed.
I think they did a pretty good job so far üôÇ

really fun to play with friends. More updated and in depth review later after I have more hours.

Update @111 hours: This is one of my favorite games ever. While the game itself is a bit rough in terms of occasional glitches and some problems with content and paywalls (but not pay to win), the gameplay loop itself is very very fun. There's an extreme satisfaction that comes from outsmarting the killer while playing as the slower survivors, and likewise a satisfaction in destroying survivors as the multitasking and demanding killer. All of the perks and characters are very fun to use; putting together fun builds is one of the best parts of this game. I strongly recommend this game, and it's usually on sale for $10 (absolute steal)!

Update @400 hours: The devs are wildly ignorant and seemingly inanely greedy. Please revert movement. Please listen to the community.

Update @500 hours: They fixed the game! The gameplay is like no other. Love this game :)
this game is awesome for survival games fans

Jogo muito foda e bom pra caralho n√£o tenho o que reclamar, pra mim o melhor de sua categoria, alem de ter varias DLC de Filmes/Series, Jogo muito bem feito e jogando com amigos o jogo fica simplesmente perfeito!
I love this game. after 30 hours of playing i still feel fear and excitement when the killer is chasing me... 10/10.

Oh boy. This game really is a treat, I enjoy it a ton. But balancing can be an issue, and without a solid team of survivors you might just get merc'd. Overall you'll enjoy this game with friends at the very least.

EDIT : I at one point really loved this game. But the community is hot garbage. If you play with other Survivors you get trash talked for not doing exactly what they wanted you to do. If you play Killer you get constantly accused of camping, tunneling, and cheating. There's no winning. I've been called racial slurs, homophobic slurs, told to just straight up kill myself more times than I can count. It's actually just about every match now. If the devs of this game won't step up to punish actual people just typing the N word at you, or won't remove the chat, then you might just be better off not playing with people like this. Not even League of Legends is this bad.
If you're getting this game thinking playing as a killer is gonna be fun you should spend your money else where. The game is favored to survivors making it a chore for any killer to enjoy a match.
Good game love it, toxic community kinda love it, FIX THE HITBOXS

Pretty cool game. Third person games aren't typically my favorite, but this game makes it work. At the time of this review, I only have 4 hours into this game, but I like it. I'm sure the feeling of your heart pounding as you run to escape the killer's grasp wears off, but it's exciting. There's a good amount of customization for every character (killers & survivors), so you can try a lot of combinations of abilities and items out. You can change your appearance as well, but most of the cosmetics cost real money. I got this game on sale and I'm not disappointed. Cross play is cool too. I would recommend watching someone else play this game either in person or youtube or something before you buy it, so you know exactly what you're getting into.
A very good team based game where every match is a risk and horror movie on it's own. The game has depth and fun new DLC.

I have enjoyed this game.  I'm not usually one for horror games, especially not PvP ones.  But I have really enjoyed playing this one with friends.  Of course there are those who play the killer and are general jerks but more often than not, it is a good game.  I  feel that there is a fair bit of diversity in play styles you can do as well.  I don't know how long this kick will last for me but I feel that I've gotten my money's worth!

Very fun, has a pretty big learning curve. although on the other side its just irritated and barely functional. def switching to VHS when it comes out. On the other hand the developers BHVR do not care about their audience and their opinions and are very petty.
